003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.geometry.line;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.util.Locale;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This class represents a line in parametric form: x = s + t v, where s is a
022 * start point on the line, v is a direction vector, and t is a real variable.
023 * Instances are immutable. See Sec. 10.1 and Appendix F.1 of [1] for details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
027 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
028 * </p>
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2022/11/18
032 */
033public class ParametricLine {
034        
035        private final double[] s, v;
036        
037        public ParametricLine(double[] s, double[] v) {
038                if (s.length != 2 || v.length != 2) {
039                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors s, v must be of length 2");
040                }
041                if (Arithmetic.isZero(Matrix.normL2squared(v))) {
042                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("direction vector (v) must be nonzero");
043                }
044                this.s = s.clone();
045                this.v = v.clone();
046        }
047        
048        public double[] getS() {
049                return s;
050        }
051
052        public double[] getV() {
053                return v;
054        }
055        
056        // --------------------------
057        
058        public static ParametricLine from(AlgebraicLine al) {
059                double[] p = al.getParameters();
060                // not needed, since algebraic lines are always normalized (i.e. A^2 + B^2 = 1)
061                double norm2 = sqr(p[0]) + sqr(p[1]);           // = A^2 + B^2
062                double scale = -p[2] / norm2;                           // = -C / ||(A,B)||^2
063                double[] s = {scale * p[0], scale * p[1]};      // = (-CA, -CB)
064                double[] v = {-p[1], p[0]};                                     // = (-B, A)
065                return new ParametricLine(s, v);
066        }
067        
068        @Override
069        public String toString() {
070                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <s=[%.3f, %.3f], v=[%.3f, %.3f]>",
071                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), s[0], s[1], v[0], v[1]);
072        }
073        
074        // --------------------------
075        
076        public static void main (String[] args) {
077                Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(1, 2);
078                Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(4, 3);
079                
080                AlgebraicLine al1 = AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2);
081                System.out.println("al1 = " + al1);
082                
083                ParametricLine pl = ParametricLine.from(al1);
084                System.out.println("pl = " + pl);
085                
086                AlgebraicLine al2 = AlgebraicLine.from(pl);
087                System.out.println("al2 = " + al2);
088                
089                System.out.println("al1 = al2 ? " + al1.equals(al2, 1e-6));
090        }
091
092        /*
093        al1 = AlgebraicLine <a=-0.316, b=0.949, c=-1.581>
094        pl = ParametricLine <s=[-0.500, 1.500], v=[-0.949, -0.316]>
095        al2 = AlgebraicLine <a=0.316, b=-0.949, c=1.581>
096        al1 = al2 ? true
097        */
098
099}
